title: How attitude is build up? - Quora

response.answer_text: An attitude usually refers to a set of behaviors, beliefs and emotions towards a specific event, thing, person or object. They are usually a result of an individual’s upbringing as well as experience and their influence over the behavior is very powerful. Even though attitudes are enduring, they can also undergo changes. A number of different factors influence the way attitudes are formed and the reason why they are formed. These include the following :- Experience – The formation of attitudes due to experience take place directly. They may be a resultant of personal experience that is direct or they might be a resultant of observation.Social Factors – A strong influence on attitudes is formed by social norms as well as social roles. Social norms are related to the rules of the society regarding the behaviors which are considered to be appropriate. Social roles are related to the behavior that the people are expected to show in a specific context or role.Learning – It is also possible to learn attitudes in a number of ways. Classical conditioning is often by advertisers to influence the attitude of the consumers for a specific product. For example, in a television commercial you might see beautiful as well as young people having fun on a beach and at the same time enjoying a sports drink.Hope this helps you :)

Attitude is something generally learned through all of our contact and external experiences. Attitudes can change. The mind dictates the change. Attitudes can be affected by external influences such as your neighborhood, associates etc. Hormones can also play a role. In my view you reflect a mix of the 5 people you most associate with, without consciously realising. Associate with positive motivated people to have it rub off on you. Mix with bad and your more likely to develop a bad attitude.

Attitude is the way we behave towards others. It is the combination of perception and our emotions towards a specific person or situation. Our attitude can be developed by understanding our emotions and perceptions. Then we will come to Know the biases we have. Then we have to try to overcome the biases one by one starting from the easiest one. This takes time and patience, but with perseverance we can achieve a state of balance.
